info.title: Registering CentOS Linux &productnumber; with the &scc;

abstract.para: This guide explains how to register and update CentOS Linux &productnumber; directly with the &scc;.
To register with &smlm;, see Registering &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &smlm;.
To register with &rmt;, see Registering &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &rmt;.

info.meta: How to use &productname; and the &scc; to update CentOS Linux &productnumber;.
Use the &scc; to update CentOS Linux &productnumber;.

important.title: End of general support
important.para: &productname; &productnumber; has reached the end of general support and is now in LTSS (Long Term Service Support).

If you have a &productname; subscription but do not have an LTSS subscription, you can continue to use your systems. However, registering new &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; systems with the general subscription is no longer supported.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: &productname; is a technology and support solution for mixed Linux environments. With a &productname; subscription, you can register and update &rhel; and CentOS Linux. Optional &ha; repositories are also available.

This guide describes how to register directly with the &scc;. This registration method is only available for CentOS Linux &productnumber; with the &productname; Lite subscription. To register &rhel; or CentOS Linux with a different &productname; subscription, you must use &smlm; or &rmt;.
